summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing transcripts and records, and negotiating a potential voluntary interview for a client, while referencing evidence including phone records showing contacts with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Lead attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY; she is coordinating with prosecutors to schedule meetings and discuss evidence.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney copied on the correspondence, involved in scheduling meetings with prosecutors regarding the grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on a case involving a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The original date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned.

events.title: Proposed Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was proposed between the defense attorneys and federal prosecutors to discuss the case.

events.title: Confirmed Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was confirmed for July 31, 2019, at 9:30 a.m. between the defense attorneys and prosecutors.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an individual represented by Winston & Strawn LLP.
Prosecutors possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls at the time of the calls.
The defense and prosecution were negotiating a potential voluntary interview with the client, leading to the adjournment of the original July 24, 2019, grand jury appearance.
The correspondence references several civil cases related to Jeffrey Epstein, including case numbers 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616, and 08 Civ. 80736.
